text:
Razumihin woke up the next morning at eight, feeling troubled and serious. He faced a bunch of new problems he didn’t see coming. Honestly, he never thought he’d wake up like this. He remembered every detail from yesterday and realized he’d had a totally unique experience—something he’d never felt before. But he also knew that the dream that had sparked his imagination was completely out of reach—so far out that it made him feel embarrassed. He quickly shifted his focus to the more practical issues left over from that “thrice cursed yesterday.”

The worst memory from the day before was how he had acted “base and mean.” It wasn’t just because he was drunk; it was because he’d taken advantage of the young girl’s situation to trash-talk her fiancé out of jealousy. He didn’t know anything about their relationship or the guy himself. What right did he have to judge him so hastily? Who asked for his opinion anyway? Could someone like Avdotya Romanovna really be marrying a guy just for money? There had to be more to him than that. The lodgings? But really, how could he...

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Razumihin wakes up troubled by the realization of his unworthy behavior and the unattainability of his dreams.
